faq.q1: What is root canal treatment and why is it needed?
faq.a1: Root canal treatment is designed to save a tooth that has suffered inflammation or infection in the root canal and allows preservation of the tooth in the mouth.
faq.a2: The treatment is usually performed under local anesthesia and should be painless – additional support is provided if needed.
faq.q3: How long does root canal treatment take?
faq.a3: Root canal treatment in standard cases takes between one to two hours and sometimes requires multiple appointments.
faq.q4: Are there any restrictions after root canal treatment?
faq.a4: In the first days after root canal treatment, it's recommended to avoid eating on the treated side and maintain strict hygiene.
